name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $identifier
desc: Returns: This records identifiers associated with this appointment concern that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

name: $addidentifier
desc: This records identifiers associated with this appointment concern that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: This records identifiers associated with this appointment concern that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed docum

name: $status
desc: Returns: The overall status of the Appointment. Each of the participants has their own participation status which indicates their involvement in the process, however this status indicates the shared status.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The overall status of the Appointment. Each of the participants has their own participation status which indicates their involvement in the process, however this status indicates the shared status.

name: $serviceCategory
desc: Returns: A broad categorisation of the service that is to be performed during this appointment.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A broad categorisation of the service that is to be performed during this appointment.

name: $serviceType
desc: Returns: The specific service that is to be performed during this appointment.

name: $addserviceType
desc: The specific service that is to be performed during this appointment.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The specific service that is to be performed during this appointment.

name: $specialty
desc: Returns: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment.

name: $addspecialty
desc: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment.

name: $appointmentType
desc: Returns: The style of appointment or patient that has been booked in the slot (not service type).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The style of appointment or patient that has been booked in the slot (not service type).

name: $reason
desc: Returns: The reason that this appointment is being scheduled. This is more clinical than administrative.

name: $addreason
desc: The reason that this appointment is being scheduled. This is more clinical than administrative.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The reason that this appointment is being scheduled. This is more clinical than administrative.

name: $indication
desc: Returns: Reason the appointment has been scheduled to take place, as specified using information from another resource. When the patient arrives and the encounter begins it may be used as the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.

name: $addindication
desc: Reason the appointment has been scheduled to take place, as specified using information from another resource. When the patient arrives and the encounter begins it may be used as the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Reason the appointment has been scheduled to take place, as specified using information from another resource. When the patient arrives and the encounter begins it may be used as the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with

name: $priority
desc: Returns: The priority of the appointment. Can be used to make informed decisions if needing to re-prioritize appointments. (The iCal Standard specifies 0 as undefined, 1 as highest, 9 as lowest priority).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The priority of the appointment. Can be used to make informed decisions if needing to re-prioritize appointments. (The iCal Standard specifies 0 as undefined, 1 as highest, 9 as lowest priority).

name: $description
desc: Returns: The brief description of the appointment as would be shown on a subject line in a meeting request, or appointment list. Detailed or expanded information should be put in the comment field.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The brief description of the appointment as would be shown on a subject line in a meeting request, or appointment list. Detailed or expanded information should be put in the comment field.

name: $supportingInformation
desc: Returns: Additional information to support the appointment provided when making the appointment.

name: $addsupportingInformation
desc: Additional information to support the appointment provided when making the appointment.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Additional information to support the appointment provided when making the appointment.

name: $start
desc: Returns: Date/Time that the appointment is to take place.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Date/Time that the appointment is to take place.

name: $end
desc: Returns: Date/Time that the appointment is to conclude.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Date/Time that the appointment is to conclude.

name: $minutesDuration
desc: Returns: Number of minutes that the appointment is to take. This can be less than the duration between the start and end times (where actual time of appointment is only an estimate or is a planned appointment request).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Number of minutes that the appointment is to take. This can be less than the duration between the start and end times (where actual time of appointment is only an estimate or is a planned appointment request).

name: $slot
desc: Returns: The slots from the participants' schedules that will be filled by the appointment.

name: $addslot
desc: The slots from the participants' schedules that will be filled by the appointment.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The slots from the participants' schedules that will be filled by the appointment.

name: $created
desc: Returns: The date that this appointment was initially created. This could be different to the meta.lastModified value on the initial entry, as this could have been before the resource was created on the FHIR server, and should remain unchanged over the lifespan of the appointment.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The date that this appointment was initially created. This could be different to the meta.lastModified value on the initial entry, as this could have been before the resource was created on the FHIR server, and should remain unchanged over the lifespan of

name: $comment
desc: Returns: Additional comments about the appointment.

name: $incomingReferral
desc: Returns: The referral request this appointment is allocated to assess (incoming referral).

name: $addincomingReferral
desc: The referral request this appointment is allocated to assess (incoming referral).

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The referral request this appointment is allocated to assess (incoming referral).

name: $participant
desc: Returns: List of participants involved in the appointment.

name: $addparticipant
desc: List of participants involved in the appointment.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: List of participants involved in the appointment.

name: $requestedPeriod
desc: Returns: A set of date ranges (potentially including times) that the appointment is preferred to be scheduled within. When using these values, the minutes duration should be provided to indicate the length of the appointment to fill and populate the start/end times for the actual allocated time.

name: $addrequestedPeriod
desc: A set of date ranges (potentially including times) that the appointment is preferred to be scheduled within. When using these values, the minutes duration should be provided to indicate the length of the appointment to fill and populate the start/end times for the actual allocated time.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A set of date ranges (potentially including times) that the appointment is preferred to be scheduled within. When using these values, the minutes duration should be provided to indicate the length of the appointment to fill and populate the start/end time
